introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• The Great Library of Alexandria was founded in the 3rd century BCE.
• It housed hundreds of thousands of papyrus scrolls.
• Scholars from around the Mediterranean traveled there to study.
• It was partially destroyed multiple times due to wars and fires.
• Many consider it one of the greatest losses of ancient knowledge in human history.
question: The student wants to emphasize the massive scale and scholarly importance of the Great Library of Alexandria. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: The Great Library of Alexandria was partly destroyed by war and fire throughout its history.
B: Thousands of scholars visited the Great Library to read from its vast collection of hundreds of thousands of papyrus scrolls.
C: Founded in the 3rd century BCE, the Great Library’s destruction is widely lamented by historians.
D: The Great Library served as a gathering place for philosophers, mathematicians, and poets.
explanation: Choice B highlights both the enormous scope of the collection and the library’s appeal to scholars from across the Mediterranean, stressing its scholarly importance and massive scale.
